title: I just wish it made larger servings!
body:
Ingenious espresso maker that doesnt require an external power source (just hot water, which you heat separately). You use a lever/piston to generate the pressure to turn beans and hot water into espresso

It works like magic and i could see this being super useful when traveling, particularly to places where the coffee scene isnt great. My only qualms are that i wish it made larger portions (i realize espresso is small in volume but it would be nice if it had the option for more), and that after awhile it is a bit tiring on the hands

Will it be my everyday coffee maker? No , but it has a niche particularly for traveling or for when you want to have an espresso without bothering to clean/prep your automatic machine

Love the idea and the execution. Bonus points for the stylish design (i got it in red) and the cute carrying case.

title: No Crema from Store-bought Coffee.
body:
Although portable and easy to use, the positives end there. I tried four different ground coffees with this and NONE of them resulted in any crema whatsoever. Apparently, this device will only produce crema if the grind size is within a very small range - which means you have to grind your own. I understand this is how true connoisseurs prefer to do things, but I'm not quite there yet.

So, unless you already grind your own beans, this device simply won't work as advertised.

title: Good for office but not for travel
body:
Low rating because it does not work for outdoor travel and requires access to hot water.
Note: MAKE SURE TO USE A TRASH CAN OR SINK WHEN OPENING AFTER USE TO AVOID COFFEE STAIN

Recommendations: pump while slightly inside rim of cup to avoid splatter

Pros - good for the office when you can't bring a nespresso machine to the office, compact, easy to put in bag, starts working after 8 pumps,

Cons - requires access to hot water to use, requires separate cup for coffee need to get nespresso capsule attachment to use with capsules, not electric, no instructions on how much water to use per serving, no fill line in water reservoir, extra water in capsule area after use, scale required for loose coffee grinds, NOT DISHWASHER COMPATIBLE

title: Easy to use, easy to clean no noise in the office
body:
I have been buying two lattes at Starbucks daily. Recently I have really wanted to find an alternative due to the cost but of almost $10/day. However I cannot use an espresso machine in the office with all the noise associated. This makes no noise and noise s so small it‚Äôs perfect. I started using it in the office kitchen but now I just use it at my desk. I also have a milk froth machine I purchased in amazon as well. This machine is easy to pump, really simple to clean and seems really well made. I purchased the one with the case for the extra $20.
Was great but only lasted 2 months. The unit seems to be losing pressure now and is much easier to press so I fear it will soon be dead.
Update: it stopped working after about 10 uses. I was really upset until I found in the instructions to remove the mesh filter with Allen wrench and clean. I did this and ran boiling hot water through it. Works great again.
